discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: I was doing something similar, but this looks cooler

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment: We could cache Coq more aggressively, but unfortunately it still doesn't give us enough time to test odd_order :S

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment:
Cool.  8.5 fails because of a timeout :-/
Merging it, and waiting for the line to be added to README.md in order to see the status on the "homepage" ;-)

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment:
BTW, the Makefile is broken and does not pass -j to submakes.
A quick workaround is `make -f Makefile.coq -j2 all`.

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment: Oh I thought the `-j n` builds worked for me in the past; feel free to adjust as you see fit, the good thing is that if you submit a PR with the change, you will immediately see the speed difference.

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment:
> waiting for the line to be added to README.md

You need to enable the math-comp repos at the Travis math-comp organization, then, you'll get the proper link to insert.

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment: @CohenCyril @assia I'd like you to enable travis (I don't have the admin right): https://github.com/mbonaci/mbo-storm/wiki/Integrate-Travis-CI-with-your-GitHub-repo

discussion.author: maximedenes
discussion.comment: Wouldn't it make sense to give the release manager (@gares) admin rights? :)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
The build of the master branch was not triggered because travis is waiting for a commit.
I submitted pull request simplifying @ejgallego install script using opam as he suggested himself.
When they are ready, a pull request will successfully trigger the first build of math-comp#master.
https://travis-ci.org/math-comp/math-comp/pull_requests

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment:
Ok, so -j2 as Enrico suggested seems to save 6 minutes[1], it may be worth trying to build at least the first part of the theorem, will push an experiment. Let's see if opam makes the build any slower thou.

[1] https://travis-ci.org/ejgallego/math-comp/builds/198974374

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment: Also note that the build in 8.5 is broken (revealed by the parallel build) as the primitive projection test seems to fail.

discussion.author: ejgallego
discussion.comment:
Ok the first part of the theorem seems to work well under my scheme, trying the full development! It is gonna be tight:

- https://travis-ci.org/ejgallego/math-comp/builds/199001333 [only BG]
- https://travis-ci.org/ejgallego/math-comp/builds/199015709 [full]
